definition: Fermi (name)/Enrico Fermi (1901-1954), Italian born US nuclear physicist
Enrico Fermi (1901-1954), Italian born US nuclear physicist

sentences.english: Like all virtuosos, Fermi had a distinctive style.
sentences.chinese: 像所艺术家一样，费米有他的独特风格。

sentences.english: Consider thermodynamic functions of the system of interacting fermions using the oscillator representation.
sentences.chinese: 利用振荡表象，考虑相互作用费米系统的热力学函数。

sentences.english: The phase diagram of a homogenous ultracold Fermi gas with spin polarization is studied at unitarity.
sentences.chinese: 研究了超冷均匀极化的费米气体在共振区的相图。

sentences.english: Then the entropies of the bosons and fermions fields are given by using the brick-wall model.
sentences.chinese: 然后利用砖墙方法计算了玻色场和费米场的熵。

sentences.english: Where do light and fermions come from?
Those antimatter beams are then picked up by Fermi's instruments.
sentences.chinese: 这些发物质束便被费米的仪器所捕获了。

sentences.english: The Fermi bubbles could be powered by the black hole at the center of our galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 费米尔泡可能是由我们银河系中心的黑洞所驱动的。

sentences.english: Particles, such as electrons, requiring antisymmetric wave functions are called fermions.
sentences.chinese: 要求反对称波函数的粒子，如电子，叫做费米子。
从十亿光年到零点一费米。

sentences.english: This idea is embodied in the Fermi Paradox.
sentences.chinese: 这个想法在费米悖论中有所体现。

sentences.english: PROVERBIAL APPLES AND ORANGES are as different as the types of quantum particles called fermions and bosons.
sentences.chinese: 费米子与玻色子的差异之大，有如橘子与苹果的不同。

sentences.english: The emission intensity is given by the absorptance of the volume in which there is a difference of the quasi Fermi energies.
sentences.chinese: 辐射强度由存在准费米能级差的体积的吸收率决定。

sentences.english: The tricritical point in the temperature-polarization plane is obtained.
sentences.chinese: 在温度和费米子极化的相图上得到了三相点的位置。

sentences.english: He believes that this process supplies the gamma-rays observed by Fermi.
sentences.chinese: 他相信这个过程产生出了费米镜观测到的伽马射线流。

sentences.english: This is the first time to achieve the DFG at home.
sentences.chinese: 这是国内首次完成的费米量子简并的实验。

definition: Werner Heisenberg (1901-1976), German physicist/also written 海森伯
Rutherford (name)/Ernest Rutherford (1871-1937), early nuclear physicist from New Zealand
Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
Higgs (name)/Peter Higgs (1929-), British theoretical physicist, one proposer of the Higgs mechanism or Higgs boson to explain the mass of elementary particles
